title: Image - Usage Examples
description: Comprehensive usage patterns for the image block with advanced sizing, alignment, captions, links, filters, and effects.

examples.name: Simple Centered Image
examples.description: Basic image centered on page with standard sizing
examples.visualDescription: Large image (800x600px) centered horizontally. No caption or link. Clean, straightforward presentation. Uses 'large' WordPress size for optimized loading.
examples.useCase: Feature images, hero images, centered visual content, blog post images

examples.name: Linked Image with Hover Opacity
examples.description: Clickable image that reduces opacity on hover for visual feedback
examples.visualDescription: Full opacity (1.0) by default. On hover: fades to 80% opacity. Smooth transition. Opens link in new tab. Right arrow cursor on hover indicates clickable.
examples.useCase: Clickable banners, product images with links, promotional images, gallery thumbnails

examples.name: Fixed Size Image with Object-Fit Cover
examples.description: Image with fixed dimensions using object-fit: cover to crop proportionally
examples.visualDescription: Fixed 400x300px container. Image scales to cover entire area while maintaining aspect ratio. Excess cropped. Perfect for uniform image cards. Center-positioned.
examples.useCase: Card grids, uniform galleries, product listings, team member photos

examples.name: Grayscale Image with Hover Color
examples.description: Black and white image that reveals color on hover
examples.visualDescription: 100% grayscale by default (black and white). On hover: grayscale fades to 0% revealing full color. Smooth transition creates engaging effect. Center-aligned.
examples.useCase: Portfolio galleries, team photos, creative presentations, interactive portfolios

examples.name: Image with Custom Caption
examples.description: Image with custom HTML caption below
examples.visualDescription: Image followed by centered caption text. Caption styling customizable via CSS. Clean typography. Useful for photo credits, descriptions, or context.
examples.useCase: Blog images with captions, photo galleries, educational content, image descriptions

attributes.ctmCap: Beautiful mountain landscape at sunset - Photo by John Doe

examples.name: Responsive Image with Max-Width
examples.description: Image that scales down on smaller screens using max-width
examples.visualDescription: Desktop: max 600px wide. Tablet: max 500px. Mobile: max 100% (full width). Never exceeds container. Maintains aspect ratio. Left-aligned.
examples.useCase: Responsive layouts, flexible content widths, mobile-friendly images

examples.name: Blurred Image with Hover Focus
examples.description: Image with blur effect that becomes sharp on hover
examples.visualDescription: 5px blur by default (subtle out-of-focus effect). On hover: blur removes, image becomes sharp. Creates focus/attention effect. Center-aligned.
examples.useCase: Interactive galleries, attention-grabbing images, creative effects, before/after reveals

examples.name: Image with Contain Fit (No Crop)
examples.description: Image scaled to fit container without cropping using object-fit: contain
examples.visualDescription: 500x400px container. Image scales to fit inside without cropping. Letterboxing/pillarboxing if aspect ratios differ. Entire image always visible.
examples.useCase: Logos, diagrams, infographics, images requiring full visibility

examples.name: Full-Width Hero Image
examples.description: Wide image spanning full container width for hero sections
examples.visualDescription: 100% width, auto height maintaining aspect ratio. Uses 'full' size for high resolution. Center-aligned. Perfect for hero sections and wide banners.
examples.useCase: Hero sections, full-width banners, page headers, section backgrounds

examples.name: Sepia-Toned Vintage Image
examples.description: Image with sepia filter for vintage/nostalgic appearance
examples.visualDescription: 80% sepia tone creates warm vintage/old photo effect. Brown-tinted aesthetic. No hover effects. Right-aligned. Perfect for historical content or vintage themes.
examples.useCase: Vintage themes, historical content, nostalgic presentations, retro designs

validationRules.block_id: Required. Unique identifier for the block.
validationRules.tImg: Required. Image object with url (image URL) and Id (WordPress media ID). Both required for proper functionality.
validationRules.iSize: WordPress image size. Values: 'thumbnail', 'medium', 'large', 'full'. Default: 'full'. Affects served image dimensions.
validationRules.tiCap: Caption type. Values: 'none' (no caption), 'default' (WordPress caption), 'custom' (custom HTML). Default: 'none'.
validationRules.capimg: Caption placeholder/alt text. Used when tiCap: 'default'.
validationRules.ctmCap: Custom HTML caption content. HTML source attribute. Requires tiCap: 'custom'.
validationRules.tiLink: Link object with url, target ('_self', '_blank'), nofollow ('', 'nofollow'). Makes image clickable.
validationRules.iWidth: Image width. Responsive. Sets width CSS property. Can use px, %, vw, etc.
validationRules.imWidth: Image max-width. Responsive. Prevents image from exceeding size. More flexible than iWidth.
validationRules.iHeig: Image height. Responsive. Sets height CSS property.
validationRules.imgFit: Object-fit CSS property. Values: 'cover', 'contain', 'fill', 'none', 'scale-down'. Requires fixed width/height.
validationRules.inOpa: Normal opacity. Value: 0-1 (0 = invisible, 1 = full). Default: '' (1).
validationRules.iHOpa: Hover opacity. Value: 0-1. Creates hover fade effect.
validationRules.inFilt: CSS filter object. openFilter: true to enable. Options: blur, grayscale, sepia, brightness, contrast, etc.

warnings: CRITICAL: Never modify or regenerate block_id - causes blocks to break.
tImg requires both url AND Id. Missing either can cause display issues.
imgFit only works when iWidth AND iHeig are both set. Otherwise ignored.
tiCap: 'custom' requires ctmCap to have content. Empty ctmCap = no caption shown.
tiCap: 'default' uses capimg as caption text. Set capimg when using default caption.
inFilt requires openFilter: true to enable. Without it, filter values ignored.
Using both iWidth (fixed) and imWidth (max) together - iWidth takes precedence, imWidth acts as fallback.
Very high blur values (>20px) can severely impact performance and look distorted.
inOpa and iHOpa use 0-1 scale, NOT 0-100 percentage.
iSize affects which image file served - 'full' = original size (large file), 'thumbnail' = smallest (fast load).
commonMistakes: Setting imgFit without both iWidth and iHeig (object-fit requires dimensions)
Using iWidth in % without parent container having defined width (unpredictable sizing)
Forgetting to set inFilt.openFilter: true when defining filters (filters don't apply)
Using inOpa: 0 (invisible image) when intending partial transparency (use 0.5-0.9)
Setting tiLink.url but forgetting target (defaults to _self, might want _blank)
Using tiCap: 'custom' without providing ctmCap HTML (no caption appears)
Setting very small iHeig with large iWidth (extreme aspect ratio distortion)
Forgetting responsive tiAlign (image aligned poorly on mobile)
Using iSize: 'full' for all images (large file sizes, slow page load)
bestPractices: Use iSize: 'large' for most images - good balance of quality and file size
Use iSize: 'full' only for hero images or when high resolution critical
Use iSize: 'thumbnail' for small avatar/icon images to optimize loading
For card grids: use imgFit: 'cover' with fixed iWidth/iHeig for uniform appearance
For logos/diagrams: use imgFit: 'contain' to prevent cropping important content
Hover opacity: reduce by 10-20% (inOpa: 1, iHOpa: 0.8) for subtle effect
Responsive alignment: center on mobile (xs: 'center'), left/right on desktop
Max-width approach: use imWidth instead of iWidth for responsive flexibility
Image captions: use tiCap: 'custom' with ctmCap for full styling control
External links: use target: '_blank' for images linking to external sites
Filters: use grayscale: 100 for B&W, sepia: 60-80 for vintage, blur: 3-5 for soft focus
Always include alt text via capimg for accessibility (even if no visible caption)
Test imgFit on actual content - 'cover' crops, 'contain' letterboxes
For clickable images: add hover effect (opacity/filter change) for visual feedback

layoutContext.parentBlocks: Can be used in any container (tp-container, tp-row/tp-column, tp-container-inner)
layoutContext.siblingBlocks: Often paired with tp-heading, tp-pro-paragraph, tp-button for content sections
layoutContext.alignmentBehavior: tiAlign applies text-align to wrapper and justify-content to figure
layoutContext.responsiveStrategy: tiAlign, iWidth, imWidth, iHeig all support responsive (md/sm/xs) breakpoints
layoutContext.imageSizeContext: iSize selects WordPress-generated image variant (affects URL and dimensions served)

performanceConsiderations: iSize: 'full' serves original image - can be very large (MBs). Use 'large'/'medium' when possible.
CSS filters (blur, grayscale, etc.) can impact render performance on many images simultaneously.
Hover opacity changes trigger repaints - minimal impact for single images, noticeable for many.
Using imgFit: 'cover' with large images requires browser to decode entire image even if cropped.
Multiple high-resolution images on page - consider lazy loading (WordPress native feature).
Blur filter with large values (>10px) more expensive than other filters.
accessibilityNotes: CRITICAL: All images should have alt text. Set via capimg even if tiCap: 'none'.
Alt text should describe image content meaningfully, not just say 'image'.
Decorative images can have empty alt (capimg: '') to skip screen reader announcement.
If image contains text, alt should include that text.
Clickable images (tiLink set) should have alt describing link destination/purpose.
Complex images (charts, diagrams) may need longer description - use ctmCap with tiCap: 'custom'.
Don't use 'image of' or 'picture of' in alt text - screen readers already announce 'image'.
Color-blind users: don't rely on color alone in images to convey information.
Ensure sufficient contrast in images containing text (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 minimum).

filterOptions.blur: Values: 0-20px. Blurs image. 0 = sharp, 5 = subtle blur, 10+ = very blurred.
filterOptions.contrast: Values: 0-200%. 100 = normal, <100 = low contrast, >100 = high contrast.
filterOptions.hue-rotate: Values: 0-360deg. Rotates hue wheel. 0/360 = normal, 180 = opposite colors.
filterOptions.sepia: Values: 0-100%. 0 = normal, 100 = full sepia (warm vintage brown tone).
